de.uni_mannheim.informatik.dws.winter.matching

Class MatchingEngine<RecordType extends Matchable,SchemaElementType extends Matchable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uni_mannheim.informatik.dws.winter.matching.MatchingEngine<RecordType,SchemaElementType>
  • Type Parameters:
    RecordType - 

    public class MatchingEngine<RecordType extends Matchable,SchemaElementType extends Matchable>
extends java.lang.Object
    The matching engine provides access to the matching algorithms for schema matching and identity resolution.
    Author:
    Oliver Lehmberg (oli@dwslab.de)

    • Method Detail

      • runDuplicateDetection

        public Processable<Correspondence<RecordType,SchemaElementType>> runDuplicateDetection(DataSet<RecordType,SchemaElementType> dataset,
                                                                                       boolean symmetric,
                                                                                       MatchingRule<RecordType,SchemaElementType> rule,
                                                                                       SingleDataSetBlocker<RecordType,SchemaElementType,RecordType,SchemaElementType> blocker)
        Runs the Duplicate Detection on a given DataSet. In order to reduce the number of internally compared AbstractRecords the functions can be executed in a symmetric-mode. Here it will be assumed, that that the MatchingRule is symmetric, meaning that score(a,b) = score(b,a). Therefore the pair (b,a) can be omitted. Normally, this option can be set to true in most of the cases, as most of the common similarity functions (e.g. LevenshteinSimilarity, and TokenizingJaccardSimilarity) are symmetric, meaning sim(a,b) = sim(b,a).
        Parameters:
        dataset - The data set
        symmetric - indicates of the used MatchingRule is symmetric, meaning that the order of elements does not matter.
        rule - The MatchingRule that is used to compare the records.
        Returns:
        A list of correspondences

      • runIdentityResolution

        public Processable<Correspondence<RecordType,SchemaElementType>> runIdentityResolution(DataSet<RecordType,SchemaElementType> dataset1,
                                                                                       DataSet<RecordType,SchemaElementType> dataset2,
                                                                                       Processable<? extends Correspondence<SchemaElementType,?>> schemaCorrespondences,
                                                                                       MatchingRule<RecordType,SchemaElementType> rule,
                                                                                       CrossDataSetBlocker<RecordType,SchemaElementType,RecordType,SchemaElementType> blocker)
        Runs identity resolution on the given data sets using the provided matching rule and blocker.
        Parameters:
        dataset1 - The first data set
        dataset2 - The second data set
        schemaCorrespondences - (Optional) Schema correspondences between the data sets that tell the matching rule which attribute combinations to compare.
        rule - The MatchingRule that is used to compare the records.
        blocker - The Blocker that generates the pairs, which are then checked by the MatchingRule.
        Returns:
        A list of correspondences

      • runSimpleIdentityResolution

        public Processable<Correspondence<RecordType,MatchableValue>> runSimpleIdentityResolution(DataSet<RecordType,SchemaElementType> dataset1,
                                                                                          DataSet<RecordType,SchemaElementType> dataset2,
                                                                                          CrossDataSetBlocker<RecordType,SchemaElementType,RecordType,MatchableValue> blocker,
                                                                                          CorrespondenceAggregator<RecordType,MatchableValue> aggregator)
        Runs identity resolution without considering the schema of records by comparing the value overlap.
        Parameters:
        dataset1 -
        dataset2 -
        blocker -
        aggregator -
        Returns:
        The found correspondences

      • runSchemaMatching

        public Processable<Correspondence<SchemaElementType,RecordType>> runSchemaMatching(DataSet<SchemaElementType,SchemaElementType> schema1,
                                                                                   DataSet<SchemaElementType,SchemaElementType> schema2,
                                                                                   Processable<? extends Correspondence<RecordType,?>> instanceCorrespondences,
                                                                                   MatchingRule<SchemaElementType,RecordType> rule,
                                                                                   CrossDataSetBlocker<SchemaElementType,SchemaElementType,SchemaElementType,RecordType> blocker)
        Runs schema matchign on the given data sets using the provided matching rule and blocker. The data sets must contain the attribute features as records.
        Parameters:
        schema1 - The first data set
        schema2 - The second data set
        instanceCorrespondences - (Optional) Instance correspondences between the data sets that tell the matching rule which instance values to compare.
        rule - The MatchingRule that is used to compare the records.
        blocker - The Blocker that generates the pairs, which are then checked by the MatchingRule.
        Returns:
        A list of correspondences

      • runLabelBasedSchemaMatching

        public Processable<Correspondence<SchemaElementType,RecordType>> runLabelBasedSchemaMatching(DataSet<SchemaElementType,SchemaElementType> schema1,
                                                                                             DataSet<SchemaElementType,SchemaElementType> schema2,
                                                                                             Comparator<SchemaElementType,RecordType> labelComparator,
                                                                                             double similarityThreshold)
                                                                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Runs label-based schema matching on the provided datasets using the specified comparator.
        Parameters:
        schema1 - The first schema
        schema2 - The second schema
        labelComparator - The comparator that compares the labels of two attributes
        similarityThreshold - The similarity threshold for creating correspondences
        Returns:
        The discovered schema correspondences
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • runInstanceBasedSchemaMatching

        public Processable<Correspondence<SchemaElementType,MatchableValue>> runInstanceBasedSchemaMatching(DataSet<RecordType,SchemaElementType> dataset1,
                                                                                                    DataSet<RecordType,SchemaElementType> dataset2,
                                                                                                    CrossDataSetBlocker<RecordType,SchemaElementType,SchemaElementType,MatchableValue> blocker,
                                                                                                    CorrespondenceAggregator<SchemaElementType,MatchableValue> aggregator)
        Runs instance-based schema matching on the provided datasets. The blocker creates initial correspondences between the schemas, which are then evaluated by the aggregator. Using an InstanceBasedSchemaBlocker, the blocking creates a correspondence for every matching value in the attributes. To measure the value overlap of two attributes as similarity value, use a VotingAggregator.
        Parameters:
        dataset1 - The first dataset (which contains the records with data, not the attributes)
        dataset2 - The second dataset (which contains the records with data, not the attributes)
        blocker - The blocker that creates pairs of attributes from the values
        aggregator - The aggregator that combined the blocker's result into final correspondences
        Returns:
        The created schema correspondences

      • runDuplicateBasedSchemaMatching

        public Processable<Correspondence<SchemaElementType,RecordType>> runDuplicateBasedSchemaMatching(DataSet<SchemaElementType,SchemaElementType> schema1,
                                                                                                 DataSet<SchemaElementType,SchemaElementType> schema2,
                                                                                                 Processable<? extends Correspondence<RecordType,?>> instanceCorrespondences,
                                                                                                 VotingMatchingRule<SchemaElementType,RecordType> rule,
                                                                                                 TopKVotesAggregator<SchemaElementType,RecordType> voteFilter,
                                                                                                 CorrespondenceAggregator<SchemaElementType,RecordType> voteAggregator,
                                                                                                 CrossDataSetBlocker<SchemaElementType,SchemaElementType,SchemaElementType,RecordType> schemaBlocker)
        Runs duplicate-based schema matching between the provided schemas. First, the VotingMatchingRule rule is evaluated for all provided instance correspondences to create votes. Optionally, these votes can be filtered by the voteFilter, i.e. to limit the number of votes that each value can cast. Then, the CorrespondenceAggregator voteAggregator combines the votes into final correspondences.
        Parameters:
        schema1 - The first schema
        schema2 - The second schema
        instanceCorrespondences - The instance correspondences (=duplicates)
        rule - The rule to cast votes from instance correspondences
        voteFilter - The filtering rule for votes (optional)
        voteAggregator - The aggregation from votes to final correspondences
        schemaBlocker - The blocker that creates potential pairs of attributes. Use NoSchemaBlocker is all combinations should be considered.
        Returns:
        The found correspondences

      • getTopKInstanceCorrespondences

        public Processable<Correspondence<RecordType,SchemaElementType>> getTopKInstanceCorrespondences(Processable<Correspondence<RecordType,SchemaElementType>> correspondences,
                                                                                                int k,
                                                                                                double similarityThreshold)
        Returns the k correspondences for each record on the left-hand side with the highest similarity score
        Parameters:
        correspondences - The correspondences that should be filtered
        k - The desired number of correspondences for each record on the left-hand side
        similarityThreshold - The minimum similarity for a correspondence to appear in the result
        Returns:
        The top k correspondences

      • getTopKSchemaCorrespondences

        public Processable<Correspondence<SchemaElementType,RecordType>> getTopKSchemaCorrespondences(Processable<Correspondence<SchemaElementType,RecordType>> correspondences,
                                                                                              int k,
                                                                                              double similarityThreshold)
        Returns the k correspondences for each attribute on the left-hand side with the highest similarity score
        Parameters:
        correspondences - The correspondences that should be filtered
        k - The desired number of correspondences for each attribute on the left-hand side
        similarityThreshold - The minimum similarity for a correspondence to appear in the result
        Returns:
        The top k correspondences
